description:
#1 Remote control app for the SqueezeBox system on WebOS devices. Control your SqueezeBox players from your phone.
This app controls Squeezebox players connected to a Squeezebox Server or MySqueezebox.com. (it might work with the SqueezeBox Touch as the server - not tested). Replicates almost every function of a Squeezebox Controller with an interface optimize for a touch screen.

Requirements: Squeezebox Server version 7.4 or better. It won't work with	anything older. Use version 7.5 or better if you plan on using MySqueezebox.com too. A MySqueezebox.com account is required if you don't use a Squeezebox Server. You can create one from within the app or on the website. And of course Squeezebox players to control.   

v2.1.1:
- When listing "All Songs" the header menu panel will now give you options for the list.
- [Bug Fixed] The drawers for items in the current playlist were showing the data of wrong items.
- [Bug Fixed] The header menu panel on the 'Current Playlist' screen does not initially open on long playlists.
- [Bug Fixed] Alarms could not be set to 12:00AM.
- [Bug Fixed] Switching to different server from the 'Connection Error' now works.
- [Bug Fixed] Correctly handle when trying to connect with 'Use Local' on, but with no defined servers.
- Internal tweaks to better handle unexpected responses from the server.
- Slight tweak to better deal with changes in Squeezebox Server 2.5.4

Notes:
Use a wifi connection if possible. A mobile data connection would work if the server is setup correctly, but the performance may not be acceptable.
When connected, this app is constantly communicating with the server. If you're using a mobile data connection, this may incur a significant data usage fee.
Tested with the SqueezeBox Receiver & Boom. Other devices should at least be controllable, but some menu items may not function correctly.
Server discovery is not yet available, but will be added in a later update.
